document.title: Tutorial
document.paragraph:
WEL is shipped with a tutorial among its sample programs. This tutorial shows you how to develop a simple WEL application and contains eight different samples listed below:
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step1/index.xml Step1 - A Basic WEL Application.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step2/index.xml Step2 - Responding to an event.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step3/index.xml Step3 - Displaying output on a WEL_CLIENT_DC.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step4/index.xml Step4 - A very basic drawing program.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step5/index.xml Step5 - Using a WEL_MODAL_DIALOG.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step6/index.xml Step6 - Re-drawing a window by redefining on_paint.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step7/index.xml Step7 - Adding menus.
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step8/index.xml Step8 - Using a WEL_OPEN_FILE_DIALOG and a WEL_SAVE_FILE_DIALOG.
